contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=June 2011}} {{Disputed|date=November 2012}} {{primary sources|date=June 2013}} {{ Infobox software | name = GNU Enterprise (GNUe) | genre = [[Enterprise resource planning|ERP]], [[Customer relationship management|CRM]], [[Supply Chain Management|SCM]] | developer = | latest release version = GNU Enterprise Reports 0.2.0. {{release date|mf=yes|2009|12|26}} | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPLv3]] | operating_system = [[Linux]], [[Mac OS X]], [[Unix]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] | programming language = [[Python (programming language)|Python]] | language = available in 3 languages | status = Active<ref>[http://www.gnuenterprise.org/cgi-bin/viewcvs.cgi/trunk/?root=gnue Trunk]</ref> | website = {{URL|http://www.gnuenterprise.org/}} }} {{ Infobox software | name = Application Server | latest_release_version = 0.5.3 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2009|10|16}} }} {{ Infobox software | name = Common Library | latest_release_version = 0.6.9 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2007|07|12}} }} {{ Infobox software | name = Forms | latest_release_version = 0.6.3 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2009|11|20}} }} {{ Infobox software | name = Navigator | latest_release_version = 0.1.0 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2009|12|26}} }} {{ Infobox software | name = Reports | latest_release_version = 0.2.0 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2009|12|26}} }} {{Portal|Free software}} '''GNU Enterprise''' (GNUe) is a meta-project started in 1996<ref>[http://www.gnuenterprise.org/community/history.php Community History]</ref> and can be regarded as a sub-project of the [[GNU Project]]. GNUe's goal is to create [[free software|free]] "enterprise-class data-aware applications" ([[enterprise resource planner]]s etc.). GNUe is designed to collect Enterprise software for the GNU system in a single location (much like the GNOME project collects Desktop software). == Developer Tools == GNUe is a set of tools, such as a data-aware user forms interface, a reporting system and an application server, which provide a development framework for enterprise information technology professionals to write or customize data-aware applications and deploy them across organizations. == ERP Packages == GNUe is also a set of packages written using the tools, to implement a full [[Enterprise Resource Planning]] system. Packages include: * human resources * accounting * customer relationship management * project management * supply chain * e-commerce GNUe supports multi-currency processing and has been translated into Greek, Hungarian, and Spanish. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official|http://www.gnuenterprise.org/}} {{Accounting software}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gnu Enterprise}} [[Category:GNU Project software|Enterprise]] [[Category:Free ERP software]] [[Category:Accounting software]] [[Category:Business software]] [[Category:Content management systems]] [[Category:Document management systems]] [[Category:Enterprise application integration]] [[Category:Enterprise architecture]] [[Category:Free accounting software]] [[Category:Free business software]] [[Category:Free project management software]] [[Category:Free reporting software]] [[Category:Financial software]] [[Category:Project management software]] [[Category:Reporting software]] [[Category:Workflow technology]] {{business-software-stub}}
